[[Image:MizzouPrimaryAthleticMark.png|115px]] | align="center" style="width:13em" |
[[Image:Iowa State Cyclones logo.svg|115px]] |- {{#if: {{{image location|}}} | {{!}} style="text-align: center;" colspan="2" {{!}} }} |- | '''Teams''' | [[Missouri Tigers football|Missouri Tigers]]
[[Iowa State Cyclones football|Iowa State Cyclones]] |- | '''Originated''' | 1959 |- | '''Series''' | Missouri leads 32-18-3 |- | '''Largest Victory''' | 2003
45-7 Missouri |- | '''Highest Scoring Game''' | 2002
42-35 Iowa State |- | '''Most Recent Game''' | 2011
52-17 Missouri |- |} The '''Telephone Trophy''' is the trophy awarded to the winner of the American [[college football]] rivalry game played annually between [[Big 12 Conference]] rivals [[Iowa State Cyclones football|Iowa State Cyclones]] of [[Iowa State University]] and the [[Missouri Tigers football|Missouri Tigers]] of the [[University of Missouri]]. The trophy has been awarded to the winner since 1959. "[http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/page2/story?page=list/strangestrivalrytrophies These really stand out in the case]" The longstanding annual rivalry has likely come to an end. Following the 2011 game, Missouri is expected to become a member of the [[Southeastern Conference]] in 2012, thus ending over 100 years of annual rivalry contests with Iowa State and many of its former [[Big Eight Conference|Big Eight]] foes. ==Trophy== The Telephone Trophy consists of an old [[rotary telephone]] that sits atop a tall wooden base http://www.iconocast.com/B000000000000034/E3/News1_5.jpg. The receiver of the telephone is painted half yellow and half red (yellow for Missouri and red for Iowa State). A large metal plate on the base of the trophy shows the complete results for each Telephone Trophy game. ==History== Before the 1959 match-up between the two schools, which took place in [[Ames, Iowa]], field testing showed that the telephones the two schools used to communicate with their coaches in the coaches box were wired so that either school could hear what was going on on the other sideline. The problem was fixed before the game, but neither of the two coaches knew that. [[Northwestern Bell]] Telephone Company of Ames then decided to have a trophy made to commemorate the incident, and thus the Telephone Trophy was born."[http://www.cyclones.com/ViewArticle.dbml?SPSID=48360&SPID=4256&DB_OEM_ID=10700&ATCLID=537512 Telephone Trophy]""[http://mutigers.cstv.com/trads/miss-mascot-trophy.html Mascot & Football Traditions]" The 1960 season game, which took place at [[Faurot Field|Memorial Stadium]] in [[Columbia, Missouri|Columbia]], [[Missouri]], had similar problems."[http://www.cyclones.com/SportSelect.dbml?SPSID=48393&SPID=4653&DB_OEM_ID=10700&KEY=&Q_SEASON=1959 Football - 1959 Schedule]""[http://www.cyclones.com/SportSelect.dbml?SPSID=48393&SPID=4653&DB_OEM_ID=10700&KEY=&Q_SEASON=1960 Football - 1960 Schedule]" ==Game results== ''Missouri victories are shaded ██ yellow.
